reviewText: it a good life abount this dvd
I have read a lot about Titanic.  this is a very good ending to some of the very sad stories of it's passengers and their families.

This is a very watchable story about a toddler that died when the Titanic went down, the boatmen who found the body and their compassion, and modern science in the form of DNA research.
It is a very touching story, a sad story but ultimately an amazing one about how scientists in the 21st century gave an unknown in a cemetary in Nova Scotia a name...over 80 years after his death.
Definitely worth renting or purchasing.

Well done documentary on the unknown child. However, they mis-identified him. "Titanic Canada" does properly identify the child and goes in depth into what was happening in Halifax during the recovery effort. Titanic Canada
